#summary Security overview of URIs with "f="
#labels Phase-Design

This was quickly converted from an e-mail, please consider it "temporary".

== Each file specified by `$_GET['f']` must: ==

  * Have the [http://code.google.com/p/minify/source/browse/tags/release_2.1.1/min/lib/Minify/Controller/MinApp.php#66 same extension, either "css" or "js"],
  * Exist, and...
  * Have a [http://code.google.com/p/minify/source/browse/tags/release_2.1.1/min/lib/Minify/Controller/Base.php#122 realpath() within a whitelist of subdirectories].

The default whitelist contains only DOCUMENT_ROOT, but can be [http://code.google.com/p/minify/source/browse/tags/release_2.1.1/min/config.php#57 specified].

Then, a few more steps just to be paranoid:

  * If a base was given by `$_GET['b']`, [http://code.google.com/p/minify/source/browse/tags/release_2.1.1/min/lib/Minify/Controller/MinApp.php#84 it can't have ".."].
  * `$_GET['f']` [http://code.google.com/p/minify/source/browse/tags/release_2.1.1/min/lib/Minify/Controller/MinApp.php#64 must not contain "//", "\", or "./"].
  * There can [http://code.google.com/p/minify/source/browse/tags/release_2.1.1/min/lib/Minify/Controller/MinApp.php#77 no duplicates] and only a [http://code.google.com/p/minify/source/browse/tags/release_2.1.1/min/config.php#73 limited number of files] can be specified.
